newsitem.title: USA: Firm works with Netscape on mainframe links to Web.
newsitem.headline: Firm works with Netscape on mainframe links to Web.

text.p: Information Builders said it is working with Netscape Communications Corp to provide access from Web technologies to mainframe computer data and applications.

Information Builders, a private firm based in New York, said at a news briefing here that it has developed two products for data access and data publishing, with plug-ins available for Microsoft Windows NT and Unix systems.

Pricing of the plugins ranges from $3,000 to $6,000 and includes a Netscape Enterprise server, said Information Builders. The two-server access and reporting products would range in price from $12,000 to $112,000 depending on processor size, it added.
The products are designed for use with International Business Corp S/390 mainframe computer systems.
Information Builders was incorporated in 1975 and boasts 1996 revenues of $263 million, with 1,750 professional employees around the world.
